messages.title: Our Homes Are Not Investment Opportunities
messages.content: John Tyson explains the Green Party's stance on housing, pushing against investor benefits and stressing the need to support existing communities.

messages.title: The NHS: Based on Need, Not Ability to Pay
messages.content: Argues against the current government charging nurses for training and advocates for reinforcing the core principles of the NHS.

messages.title: Standing Up for Democracy on Europe
messages.content: Calls for a second referendum on Brexit with the provision of more accurate information to voters.

messages.title: We Need Action from the Mayor to Clean Up Our Air
messages.content: Highlights the Green Party’s efforts in addressing air pollution and calls on the Mayor for further action.

messages.title: Solidarity with All Southwark People
messages.content: Discusses solidarity with Southwark residents, addressing various issues including Brexit, housing, and local services.

messages.title: Vote John Tyson: A Fresh Voice for Southwark
messages.content: John Tyson shares his background, beliefs, and dedication to making politics open and transparent.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Homes should be for residents, not for investment. The party opposes the Bedroom Tax and supports council housing.
The NHS should remain based on need, advocating for policy changes to ensure fair tax systems to support it.
Supports a second referendum on Brexit with accurate facts presented to voters.
Calls for action to reduce air pollution, particularly harmful for children and older people.

issues.brexitEurope: Calls for a second referendum on Brexit to ensure voters are adequately informed before making a decision.
issues.environment: Addresses air pollution and calls for the Mayor to take action on reducing harmful diesel emissions.
issues.health: Promotes maintaining the NHS based on need, opposing measures that impose financial burdens on healthcare providers and patients.

community.content: The Green Party opposes turning homes into investment opportunities and supports maintaining existing communities.

leaflet.personalStatement: John Tyson is a chartered accountant who is dedicated to making politics transparent and prioritizing local issues and community engagement.

images.caption: Greens-John and Liba defending the Aylesbury

examples: Southwark voted overwhelmingly to remain in the EU, with 72.8% of votes.
A fair tax system goes to the heart of what it means to be a just and equitable society.
The core principles of the NHS are under attack from the Tories.
Homes should be for residents, not for investment.
We've written to Southwark Council to call for immediate action.
Homes should be for residents, not for investment.
Calls for a second referendum on Brexit.
The core principles of the NHS are under attack from the Tories.

personalStories.story: John is a chartered accountant and lives in Elephant and Castle. He is active in the Friends of Harper Road and Elephant Amenity Network.

examples: Southwark needs investment in housing, not investors benefiting from homes.
The core principles of the NHS are under attack from the Tories.
John Tyson is a local campaigner.
